result.execSummary:
The defendant Roman Anthony Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay a fine of $350 plus all other fees, surcharges and assessments, except for dv surcharge, which was waived by the court.  In lieu of paying fine, costs and surcharges, the defendant can perform 40 hours of community service.  If the defendant decides to pay the fine and costs, the court ordered it to be paid by 3/9/16.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant to serve 3 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days time served.  Defendant to provide DNA sample if one has not already been given; pay dna surcharge.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roman Anthony Simmons in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
cab
Case was calendared for a jury trial today.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.
  Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises that they have complied with Section 971.095(2), Wis. Stats.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Angel W..  The victim requests that the no contact order be removed.
.
Parties are proceeding to sentencing.

.
Defendant sentenced to serve 3 days at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, with credit for 3 days time served.
.
COURT ORDERS:
- Defendant to provide DNA sample if one has not already been given; pay DNA surcharge.
- Defendant to pay a fine of $350.00 plus all other fees, surgcharges and assessments, except for the DV surcharge, which was waived by the court.  In lieu of paying fine, costs and surcharges, the defendant can perform 40 hours of community service.  If the defendant decides to pay the fine and costs, the court ordered it be paid by 03/09/2016  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
.
Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant.

Received and filed:
Justice Point report.
cab
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Roman Anthony Simmons in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The defendant did appear in the afternoon and showed the court a return to court slip that stated his court date was in the afternoon.
The court withdrew the warrant and reinstated the bail.
Case remains calendared for a jury trial in Branch 36.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.

Defendant failing to appear, the Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  The Court ordered cash bond/signature bond forfeited.  The Court ordered Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.  The Court ordered that the defendant be REMANDED to the trial court upon return on the bench warrant.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Roman Anthony Simmons in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are in court for a violation report.
The defendant was ordered to check in with Justice Point as soon as he leaves this court.
Defense counsel requests that the plea hearing remain on in Branch 36.

  Plea hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report (missed office contact) received and filed. Parties contacted to address the violation.  Bail hearing scheduled for 08/18/2015 at 1:30pm in Branch 36.

Defendant Roman Anthony Simmons in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. Defendant in court, due to lateness of the hour court excused defendant from reporting to Justice Point today, Justice Point is closed. Defendant advised he must arrange to make up appointment with Justice Point, and is to call 7/7/2015 to reschedule. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Roman Anthony Simmons in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Angela W.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Roman Anthony Simmons in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Roman Anthony Simmons in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
